channel.title: üè¢ McGill University on NeurIPS 2024
channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ McGill University on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: 4+3 Phases of Compute-Optimal Neural Scaling Laws
item.description: Researchers discovered four distinct compute-optimal phases for training neural networks, offering new predictions for resource-efficient large model training.

item.title: Action Gaps and Advantages in Continuous-Time Distributional Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Distributional RL’s sensitivity to high-frequency decisions is unveiled, with new algorithms solving existing performance issues in continuous-time RL.

item.title: Adaptive Exploration for Data-Efficient General Value Function Evaluations
item.description: GVFExplorer: An adaptive behavior policy efficiently learns multiple GVFs by minimizing return variance, optimizing data usage and reducing prediction errors.

item.title: Density-based User Representation using Gaussian Process Regression for Multi-interest Personalized Retrieval
item.description: GPR4DUR leverages Gaussian Process Regression to create density-based user representations for accurate multi-interest personalized retrieval, overcoming limitations of existing methods.

item.title: Efficient Reinforcement Learning by Discovering Neural Pathways
item.description: Discover efficient neural pathways for reinforcement learning; drastically reducing model size and energy consumption without sacrificing performance.

item.title: From Linear to Linearizable Optimization: A Novel Framework with Applications to Stationary and Non-stationary DR-submodular Optimization
item.description: A novel framework extends optimization algorithms from linear/quadratic functions to a broader class of ‘upper-linearizable’ functions, providing a unified approach for concave and DR-submodular optim…

item.title: HardCore Generation: Generating Hard UNSAT Problems for Data Augmentation
item.description: HardCore: Fast generation of hard, realistic UNSAT problems for improved SAT solver runtime prediction.

item.title: Parseval Regularization for Continual Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Boost continual reinforcement learning with Parseval regularization: maintaining orthogonal weight matrices preserves optimization, significantly improving RL agent training across diverse tasks.

item.title: Periodic agent-state based Q-learning for POMDPs
item.description: PASQL, a novel periodic agent-state Q-learning algorithm, significantly improves reinforcement learning in partially observable environments by leveraging non-stationary periodic policies to overcome …

item.title: Robot Policy Learning with Temporal Optimal Transport Reward
item.description: Temporal Optimal Transport (TemporalOT) reward enhances robot policy learning by incorporating temporal order information into Optimal Transport (OT)-based proxy rewards, leading to improved accuracy …

item.title: The High Line: Exact Risk and Learning Rate Curves of Stochastic Adaptive Learning Rate Algorithms
item.description: Researchers developed a framework for analyzing stochastic adaptive learning rate algorithms, providing exact risk and learning rate curves, revealing the importance of data covariance and uncovering …

item.title: Trajectory Flow Matching with Applications to Clinical Time Series Modelling
item.description: Simulation-free Neural SDE training via Trajectory Flow Matching unlocks scalability and stability for modeling complex real-world time series, particularly in clinical settings.
